entry.title: Limit use of calc-size() within other expression contexts.
entry.content:
This restricts the use of calc-size() to the toplevel expression and to

the basis of another calc-size() expression. (It should eventually also

be allowed in mix() when we support that.) It implements the

restriction in the same way that the spec describes it: based on the

idea that its type is not a length.



Bug: 313072

entry.title: Remove composited-animations-rotate-zero-degrees test
entry.content:
This test was added back when we have difficulty testing composited

rendering. When paused, an animation is no longer composited. Thus,

we needed to run on a playing animation. We have a sampling API that

effectively pauses the animation on the compositor, but this API is

not cross-browser compatible. We have cross-browser ways of achieving

the same goal using timing functions. This test no longer adds any

real value and can be safely removed without eroding test coverage.



Handling of zero rotations is addressed in:

wpt/css/css-transforms/animation/support/transform-interpolation-reftests.js





Bug: 40280753

Change-Id: Ifd78588f972cf72cf28353a05eb6f9ec9dc4a272

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5378651

entry.title: [profile] Refactor profile color persistence logic
entry.content:
Currently we update profile colors only in the case of a user

having an explicitly set profile color (for autogenerated or

refresh themes).



This CL now always updates profile color regardless of theme

state. This serves to preserve the user's current color scheme

state.



Default profile colors are now only used for Chrome Web Store

extension themes and system themes (linux x11). In all other

cases profile colors will be generated based on the applied

theme. This is true for autogenerated themes and all cases of

the new chrome refresh suite of themes.



See screenshots below for changes with differing system and

browser color schemes when using the chrome default theme.



Light:

before: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/3Whjs4jyFBBxaad.png

after: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/BKjtQPGRVodDQVJ.png

Dark:

before: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/AHZCVrDPeLjrVUg.png

after: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/BYQrrX3AGZCkkAh.png



Bug: 40924613

entry.title: iwa: Inject CSP and CO*P headers in URLLoader instead of NavigationRequest
entry.content:
This moves CSP and CO*P header injection from NavigationRequest in

//content to IsolatedWebAppURLLoader. This is one of the biggest pieces

of IWA-specific logic in //content, which will now be in //chrome with

the rest of the IWA core. This also switches the injection from being

based on on WebExposedIsolationInfo to being tied to the IWA

URLLoaderFactory, which is more correct as these restrictions are a

property of IWAs, not the isolation level.



This should fix a few crashes we were seeing when pages inject extra

CSP, and will allow us to customize the injected CSP in the future based

on data from the WebAppDatabase, which we can't currently do.



This adds some additional tests and largely rewrites the existing tests

to be based on existing IWA test helpers.



Bug: b/323257846

Change-Id: Iac6e351478bbd387c966341971dd99bb0c0c4be6

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5350939

entry.title: libaom: Disable quantization matrix
entry.content:
Quantization Matrix is not used for realtime.

And libaom decoder has been disabled, so Quantization Matrix

can be disabled though it's shared between the encoder and decoder.



Reduces the binary size of the libaom shared lib on linux by about 0.4MB.

entry.title: [Extensions] Move UnhandledKeyboardEvent() to private method
entry.content:
UnhandledKeyboardEvent() is only called by a method in the same class.

entry.title: Chrome gcapi: use IProcessLauncher SxS IID introduced by the Updater
entry.content:
This CL makes gcapi query for the IProcessLauncherSystem IID first,

with a fallback to the legacy IProcessLauncher IID. This is to make sure

that marshaling loads the proxy/stub from the correct (HKLM) hive.



Omaha3 incorrectly registers the IProcessLauncher IID for both user and

system installs, even though IProcessLauncher is only meant for system,

which can cause marshaling failures if the Omaha3 user install is broken

with a system Omaha4, hence this change.



Bug: 329169242

Change-Id: I29ee73d158d350cb4f45222933936be868aa38ba

entry.title: Reland "Posting registerLocaleChangeReceiver to BG thread"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 872620ee34e127b714c3f59a05774f665042b2f7



In this reland, we post registerReceiver calls to a sequencedTaskRunner and the unregister call to the sequencedTaskRunner. Serializing these calls should ensure the register calls occur before the unregister call.



Original change's description:

> Posting registerLocaleChangeReceiver to BG thread

>

> This is in an effort to move as many calls to

> ContextUtils#registerProtectedBroadcastReceiver off of the UIThread.

> This is part of an effort to improve runtime performance by reducing

> the number of IActivityManager binder transactions in the UIThread.

>

entry.title: ChromeDriver: Plumb Chrome's StackTrace.
entry.content:
There are dangling pointers on Mac:

https://issues.chromium.org/issues/330009945



WebDriver do not report the crash, making this impossible to debug. This

patches adds this information to the exception.



Error example:

```

exceptions.UnknownError: unknown error: session deleted because of page crash

from unknown error: cannot determine loading status

from tab crashed

(Session info: chrome=124.0.6366.0)



StackTrace:



#0 0x7f619797f46c base::debug::CollectStackTrace() [../../base/debug/stack_trace_posix.cc:1039:7]

#1 0x7f6197931d3a base::debug::StackTrace::StackTrace() [../../base/debug/stack_trace.cc:234:12]

#2 0x7f6197931cf5 base::debug::StackTrace::StackTrace() [../../base/debug/stack_trace.cc:231:28]

```



Bug: chromium:330009945

Change-Id: I9ad6b0536042e3bb36ae6c9ef0f76553ba380eee

entry.title: Ignore app shim re-open events triggered by notification actions.
entry.content:
When the user clicks on a notification, macOS sends our app a "re-open"

event. We don't actually want to treat notification clicks as re-open

triggers though. Since there doesn't seem to be a good way to detect

specifically these re-open events, this CL instead ignores re-open

events for a small time period after handling a notification click.



While this change does prevent a app window from being opened when we

don't want it to, unfortunately the OS still makes the PWA be the

active app (regardless of if it has any windows open). But that is

at least less disruptive than opening an extra window would be.

entry.title: [iOS] Allow WhatsNew badge to be displayed in multiple windows
entry.content:
Currently, the WhatsNew FET feature does not block itself or other

FET features, so it should be able to show in multiple windows. This

is also the desired behavior; the new badge should appear in both

windows.



However, the FET currently only allows each FET feature to show a single

time. To work around this, this CL introduces a new stored

SupportsUserData state, stored off of the FET itself. This stored state

tracks how many active WhatsNew new badges there are. If there already

is one, then the menu just adds the badge to WhatsNew without querying

the FET. And then the menu only alerts the FET of the WhatsNew feature's

dismissal when all active menus have closed.



Bug: 328393153, 328201792

entry.title: [DIPS] Don't delete cookies partitioned under non-tracking sites.
entry.content:
Until now, if DIPS judged a site to be tracking, its cookies would also

be cleared when partitioned under other, non-tracking sites.



This makes it difficult for sites to migrate to CHIPS.



By setting an empty cookie partition key collection on the

BrowsingDataFilterBuilder, we will only delete tracking sites'

unpartitioned cookies.

entry.title: Chrome rename: use IProcessLauncher SxS IID introduced by the Updater
entry.content:
This CL makes Chrome query for the IProcessLauncherSystem IID first,

with a fallback to the legacy IProcessLauncher IID. This is to make sure

that marshaling loads the proxy/stub from the correct (HKLM) hive.



Omaha3 incorrectly registers the IProcessLauncher IID for both user and

system installs, even though IProcessLauncher is only meant for system,

which can cause marshaling failures if the Omaha3 user install is broken

with a system Omaha4, hence this change.



Bug: 329169242

entry.title: [Android][CredMan] Increase min GMS versions for all channels
entry.content:
The minimum GMS Core version for CredMan support rises to

* 24W04 for Dev/Canary (which has launched-approved features), and

* 24W10 for Beta/Stable (which includes a fix for non-discoverable

credentials that was temporarily broken)

developers from using earlier versions already without the hassle of

installing a GMS version before its public release.

entry.title: Add IP addresses to the DnsOverHttpsTemplatesWithIdentifiers policy
entry.content:
The DnsOverHttpsTemplatesWithIdentifiers policy allows admin to include

user and device identifiers in the DoH URI template by specifying

placeholders which are replaced on the device with real user or device

data.



This CL adds a new placeholder to the policy, DEVICE_IP_ADDRESSES. This

placeholder will be replaced by a hex string representing the network

byte order of the IPv4 address and/or IPv6 address associated with the

current network, if the network is managed by policy.



go/ip-for-doh-uri-template

entry.title: Revert "[iOS] Add TabGrid context menu action to move a tab to a (new) group"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 9fcdedd39e1714ea4da77001ae083c2af69387c5.



Reason for revert: This appears to be causing

TabGroupsTestCase/testCreateTabGroupIsDisplayedAfterLongPressATab

to fail on multiple bots:

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/ios-fieldtrial-rel/25688/overview

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/ios-simulator-full-configs/54648/overview



Original change's description:

> [iOS] Add TabGrid context menu action to move a tab to a (new) group

>

> This CL makes sure that the context menu action on a TabGrid cell to

> add it to a new or existing group is working as expected, including in

> multiwindows.

>

> It differentiate when there are some existing tab groups and when

> there is none. It also makes sure that the string takes into account

> the number of tabs to add.

>

> It adds helper to get all multiwindow groups, move tabs to a group in

> any window and move the "ContainsGroup" method of the WebStateList to

> public.

>

> Move all the tab_grid utils files in the same target and allow

> circular dependencies.

> Move the item identifier in their own target too.

>

entry.title: canvas: don't call Transform() with the identity transform
entry.content:
The specific thing I want to avoid is GetModifiablePath().

I want to avoid GetModifiablePath() as it may trigger creation

of an SkPath. In the case of the identity transform, transform()

will do nothing, so no need to trigger to creation of the SkPath.



This is part of adding support for an arc paint op.

This reverts commit d9c252b13b876bcc662adb3134e08493b427dbf8.



Reason for revert:

Original change's description:

> exo: Emit trace events for all Wayland events and requests.

>

> This lets us visualize interactions between Exo and its clients

> using Perfetto's timeline view, in context with other Exo/Ash

> TRACE_EVENTs. The formatting is similar to that given by the

> WAYLAND_DEBUG environment variable.

>

> Arguments aren't logged yet, but if the approach looks good it

> should be easy enough to add them in a follow-up CL.

>

entry.title: WebUI: Move cr-policy-pref-indicator to settings_shared
entry.content:
This element is a better fit for the settings_shared folder, since it

implicitly relies on the settings prefs mechanism and has a dependency

on chrome.settingsPrivate.



This is in preparation for migrating other elements in this folder to

CrLitElement. Consequently, also removing CrPolicyIndicatorMixin,

since it is used by only 2 elements, and CrPolicyIndicator will be

migrated to Lit in a followup CL. Lit and Polymer elements can't share

mixins, so rather than having 2 elements that each have a mixin not

used elsewhere, merge the mixin logic into the elements themselves.

entry.title: [BRP] Expand "same slot" mode slightly, now that "previous slot" is gone
entry.content:
This is a follow-up to crrev.com/c/5371667, landed separately so that

the former can be a no-op.



There were some things that couldn't be done while "previous slot"

was supported:

1. Freelist shadow entry

2. Clearing/poisoning the slot till the very end on free

That's because the decision about these had to be done at compile time,

whereas selection between same slot/previous slot modes was done at

run-time.

entry.title: [iOS] Only trigger BVC's fullscreen update when the size class changes
entry.content:
Currently any change to the traitCollection triggers an update of the

elements BVC. It seems that they only need to listen to the size class

so only trigger the update if the size class changes.



The issue here is that the fullscreen model's offset is only updated

when the BVC becomes visible. However, the trait collection is updated

before it is visible. So traitCollectionDidChange is called while the

fullscreen model still has the offset of the previous tab (which was

scrolled to the top). At the end of the trait collection updates, the

model makes sure that the WebView is still scrolled to the top. But

the WebView has changed before trait collection was called, so the

model is scrolling to the top the new WebView, which shouldn't be

scrolled to the top.



This CL also uses the SceneState's window to override the user

interface style as it is more clear about the purpose.



Another solution would have been to fix fullscreen and change the way

it is listening to content offset updates.



Bug: 328766487

Change-Id: I7c7b3aadb513c657fe9630100e30dd14f668c0e3

entry.title: Use span in IvfParser and SpanWriter in WriteWavHeader
entry.content:
WriteWavHeader moves from its pointer-based CharWriter to our

new SpanWriter in base.



SpanWriter contains methods for writing spans of values, but

also if the SpanWriter is over a byte-array, then it allows

writing integers in native, little, and big endian into the

array.



Use spans internally IvfParser, though the storage type is not changed

yet.

entry.title: [Uno-d] Add helper function `IsImplicitBrowserSigninOrExplicitDisabled`
entry.content:
`IsImplicitBrowserSigninOrExplicitDisabled()` will be used to disntguish

Dice users with the feature off or on but they were implicitly signed

in, therefore they might be subject to pre-Explicit browser sign in

behavior.



The function will return true:

- If the explicit browser sign in is disabled

- or the user is signed in implicitly.

Otherwise, returns false when the feature is off and the user is either

signed out or signed in explicitly. In this case, explicit browser sign

in fully applies.



Bug: b/329576073

entry.title: [gpu] Fix improperly freed dangling ptr in DecoderPerfTest
entry.content:
DecoderPerfTest has raw_ptr for gles2_implementation which is created

in Setup after context. During Teardown the context gets reset before

gles2_implementation which leaves it dangling. This fixes that by

removing the whole Teardown as test suite should automatically handle

it in destructor.



Also add ClearMappedBufferMap and ClearMappedTextureMap in Gles2Impl

which frees shared memory and clear maps in case appropriate Unmaps

are not called. This is more as a precautionary measure.



Bug: 330111612

entry.title: [iOS] Add TabGrid context menu action to move a tab to a (new) group
entry.content:
This CL makes sure that the context menu action on a TabGrid cell to

add it to a new or existing group is working as expected, including in

multiwindows.



It differentiate when there are some existing tab groups and when

there is none. It also makes sure that the string takes into account

the number of tabs to add.



It adds helper to get all multiwindow groups, move tabs to a group in

any window and move the "ContainsGroup" method of the WebStateList to

public.



Move all the tab_grid utils files in the same target and allow

circular dependencies.

Move the item identifier in their own target too.

entry.title: [Topics] Measure a misuse pattern: topics called on a page after redirects
entry.content:
What: When Topics API is first invoked in a page, record 1) the

number of automated client-side redirect occurred before this page,

and 2) among those redirects, the number of pages that invoked

Topics API.



Why: Topics API can be misused when a site gets topics and passes

it to the next site in the URL param via automated redirect, and

repeating this process several times allows the cooperating sites

to get all the user's topics upon a single page visit (i.e. 3 topics

per site, and 15 topics from 5 sites). Thus, we want to better

understand the usage patterns.



How: Add a WebContentsObserver that tracks the topics usage in a

chain of automated redirects, by getting the previous page's redirect

status, updating it, and initializing the next page with the updated

status. When Topics API is first used in a page, record UMA metrics.

See the class comment for `BrowsingTopicsRedirectObserver` for

details.



Bug: 329312215

Change-Id: Ie9c63a72427ed45c3eb30927b7797af200c19437

entry.title: [ios] Nuke advanced sync setup flow
entry.content:
This only changes behavior when kReplaceSyncPromosWithSignInPromos is

disabled. End users are not supposed to experience that, the feature

is launched. This is one more step towards cleaning up the flag.



This change concerns the "advanced sync setup flow", which has 2 entry

points: in the FRE sync consent screen (/tangible_sync/) and in the

standalone sync consent screen (/user_signin/). After this CL, the

entry points are still displayed but do nothing on click. The reason

they are not removed is that the host screens will be deleted in

future clean-ups. It's not worth updating the screens now.



The starting point of the CL is changing the click handlers [1][2]

to NOTIMPLEMENTED(). NOTREACHED_NORETURN() is not appropriate, the

code path is still reachable strictly speaking. From then on, the CL

just keeps deleting dead code and simplifying.

[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ios/chrome/browser/ui/authentication/unified_consent/unified_consent_view_controller.mm;l=470;drc=9f117bc330a5378c498989fa52c75b31c006f4f1

[2] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ios/chrome/browser/ui/authentication/tangible_sync/tangible_sync_coordinator.mm;l=184;drc=0e2b498718d0b316b6e1d4cce8af92a722588e03
